subject: Politics
title: Whistleblowers
description: A fast breakdown of Whistleblowers for builders.

hook.text: Edward Snowden exposed mass surveillance and lost his freedom. Whistleblowers risk everything to tell the truth.

buildup.text: Whistleblowers reveal corruption, fraud, and abuse from inside organizations. They are often the only source of truth.

discovery.text: The US False Claims Act lets whistleblowers keep a share of recovered funds. Financial incentives actually work.

twist.text: Most whistleblowers face retaliation: job loss, lawsuits, imprisonment, or exile. Protection laws exist but often fail.

climax.text: Without whistleblowers, Enron, Watergate, and NSA surveillance might never have been exposed.

punchline.text: Whistleblowers are democracy's fire alarm. Punishing them helps the fire spread.

quiz.question: What does the US False Claims Act offer whistleblowers?
options: A share of recovered funds as a financial incentive
